alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 1:28AM PDT until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southern and Central San Luis Obispo County in Southwest California. * WHEN...Until 430 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain falling across the advisory areas due to a line of strong showers and thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Pismo Beach, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Grover Beach, Black Mountain, Lake Lopez, Oceano, Shell Beach and Carrizo Plain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
